item.title: DiffusionDrive: Truncated Diffusion Model for End-to-End Autonomous Driving
item.description:
CVPR 2025 (Highlight) · Horizon Robotics · arXiv · Code

Motivation

  • Unimodal
    • Regression
      • e.g. Transfuser, UniAD, VAD, PPAD,
  • Multimodal
    • Discretization of the continuous action space
      • e.g. VADv2, Hydra-MDP, Hydra-MDP++, SparseDrive
      • cons
        • Fail in out-of-vocabulary scenarios
        • Large computation cost
    • Anchor-based regression: HAOMO
    • Diffusion
      • Vanilla diffusion policy
        • cons
          • Heavy denoising overhead. The numerous 20 denoising steps in the vanilla DDIM diffusion policy introduce heavy computational consumption during inference
          • Mode collapse. The different random noises converge to similar trajectories after the denoising process.
      • Truncated diffusion policy
        • e.g. DiffusionDrive

Diffusion model has proven to be a powerful generative technique for robotic policy learning, capable of modeling multimodal action distributions.
